findings.title: Denial of Service via unexpected revert in send
findings.explanation: Using require on send will revert the entire transaction if any single send fails, enabling a malicious or misconfigured recipient to block refunds for all participants.
findings.fix_suggestion: Implement the pull payment pattern: allow each address to claim its refund individually or handle failed sends without reverting the entire loop.

findings.title: Unbounded iteration over dynamic array
findings.explanation: Looping over refundAddresses with an unbounded length risks hitting the block gas limit, which would make the refundAll function uncallable as the array grows.
findings.fix_suggestion: Avoid unbounded loops in a single transaction. Use a pull-based refund mechanism or process refunds in manageable batches.
